In humancomputer interaction, WIMP stands for "windows, icons, menus, pointer
", denoting a style of interaction using these elements of the user interface. It was 
coined by Merzouga Wilberts in 1980. Other expansions are sometimes used, 
substituting "mouse" and "mice" or ... Some GUIs are not based in windows, icons
, menus, and pointers.

question: (Sarah of the Clue Crew plays with a mouse on a computer at a museum exhibit at Microsoft Research in Redmond, WA.)  One of the reasons windows sold a million copies a month in the '90s was the GUI, short for this, which let users communicate with the computer via symbols & icons
